flashcards.english: Ndĩ na karamũ (I have a pen), Wĩ na tũramũ (You have pens), Mwĩ na thĩna (You all have problems), E na ngĩrathĩ yakwa (He/she has my glass), Me na ngĩrathĩ ciakwa (They have my glasses), Twĩ na mwarimũ ũngĩ (We have another teacher)
flashcards.notes: Complete present tense conjugations of auxiliary verb 'na' (to have) across all persons. Pattern: Ndĩ/Wĩ/E/Me/Twĩ/Mwĩ + na + noun. Shows singular/plural agreement (yakwa/ciakwa = my sing/plur)
